Authors:
Carolina Guadalupe Pina Paez, Michael A. Castellano,
Roberto Garibay Orijel, James M. Trappe
Title:
New Species and Records of Hypogeous, Sequestrate
Basidiomycetes from Temperate forests across the Trans-Mexican Volcanic
Belt
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Barcodes, diversity, false truffles,
Gautieria, Leucogaster, Melanogaster, Schenella, Trappea.
Abstract:
This study contributes to the knowledge of diversity and
distribution of hypogeous, sequestrate fungi along the Trans-Mexican
Volcanic Belt (TMVB) in pine, fir and oak forests. The fungi were
collected from 8 sites, including 3 sites in National Parks (Cumbres del
Ajusco, La Malinche, and Nevado de Toluca). Specimens were described
macro- and microscopically, and photographed under light microscopy and
scanning electron microscopy (SEM). Genetic barcodes for most specimens
were generated and these DNA sequences were used to support new species
by Maximum Likelihood phylogenetic analysis. Species in five genera
(Basidiomycota) are presented: Gautieria, Leucogaster, Melanogaster,
Schenella and Trappea, including four new species: Gautieria aztecana,
G. neovulcanica, Leucogaster pulqueana, and Melanogaster ajuscoensis,
and three new records for different geographic areas.
